pistorio i hope you enjoy creating your own little sea creature do not bind off cut do not bind off cut yarn leaving long tail and thread yarn leaving long tail yarn tail onto large-eyed blunt needle thread and thread yarn tail needle through loops of the remaining 10 sts but do onto large-eyed not pull up to gather yet stuff the turtle firmly then blunt needle pull up on yarn to gather and secure thread needle use the long tails to close the openings between the through loops of the legs head/neck and tail turtle should sit flat on a remaining 10 sts surface secure yarn tails and pull up to gather and secure continuing now with the top of the turtle… beginning at the left back leg place the 50 sts from yarn holder underside a onto the crab needles beginning the legs… make 8 leaving long tail cast on 6 sts and join in-the-round… rounds 1-9 k do not bind off cut yarn leaving long tail this tail will be used later to close the openings between the legs stuff leg…now at the cast-on edge thread round 1 attach working yarn turtle color b and yarn tail onto large-eyed blunt needle insert needle knit around through the outer loops of the 6 cast-on stitches and 2 p this will create a ridge around the bottom of the pull up to gather and secure turtle shell place the first 3 3-6 k stitches onto a yarn 7 k3 k2tog x 10 = 40 sts holder a 8-9 k place the last 3 10 k2 k2tog x 10 = 30 sts stitches onto a 11-12 k different color yarn 13 k1 k2tog x 10 = 20 sts holder b 14-15 k after completing the second leg place it as 16 k2tog x 10 = 10 sts you did the first one on the two yarn holders
